reviews.text: Great place to visit. I've been here and there but Grenada is something really different. Architecture is very intense, buildings are closely packed. Cathedral is spectacular, not big but simply huge, spacious inside, sandwitched between other buildings, tough to take picture when outside. I suggest it to everyone.

While I've walked into at least a dozen similar cathedrals in Spain, they always impress me with their sheer size, architectural and cultural value. This one did not disappoint. Definitely worth the entrance fee.

Elegant and refined homage to the Christian faith - containing massive organs in stereo - two huge beasts that fill the cavernous space with soaring music. Don’t miss the illuminated song books at the back hand cast with massive sheets of music for reading from a distance, rendered in glorious colour on parchment.

Very cool place to see. It is such a grand sight inside and much larger than you can see in pictures. The chapel is extremely detailed and beautiful. Get the Granada card and you’re allowed in for free, along with many other sights and attractions including Alhambra.

Beautiful big cathedral.
Massive and impressive.
One of the biggest chapels i have ever been in.
Really nice decorated.
Too much to see, even with audio guide.
Audio guide gives you a nice historical detailed story about the church history.
Worth visiting.

Don't forget the Royal chapel on the back.
Lovely little museum. Definitely worth a visit. Lots of history!
Part of the history, so go if you are historically interested, it not you can skip if you see Alhambra...

Last standing medieval hotel structure where travelers spent the night on their travels along the silk road. Sibarius Restaurant is right down the street from there.  Great place for lunch after touring the historic sites.
Old market Square in the centre of the city, worth a visit and look around. Another good spot for shade on a hot day!
An interesting example of a caravanserrai. Is a nice old courtyard in the middle of the modern granada

VEry traditional place in Bilbao, also a very touristy place in Bilbao. It is a nice inner courtyard with plenty of small bars and restaurants all around. It is a good place both for a formal sit-down meal as well as for only a drink and a small snack.
This Plaza offers an amazing outdoor space surrounded by many cafés and restaurants. Though It was quiet and empty when I visited in March! Guess in summer it gets busy

İt is a historic and touristic plaza at the 1old town" part of Bilbao with full of selections restaurants,cafe and bars for a drink or food and souvenirs..You can enjoy your drink outside while enjoying the sun and the sorroundings..Prices are moderate  and plenty to choose from
lucky to be here in the miďle of a festival.  the atmosphere was electric and the locals were so kind...

Beautiful and most historic place of down town Bilbao.
A must visit area.

Best museum we've seen in Granada. Large and extensive collection of artifacts and art centered on San Juan de Dios, including his staff, bed, and begging basket. The room and spot where he expired have been preserved and are quite atmospheric. Highly recommended stop. We also visited his church (!!!) and his cell at the Hospital Real (university library).
Very good and not expensive. You could do worse than just sit in the courtyard (which is free to enter) and enjoy the tranquility
Excellent museum, showcasing the life of st Juan. A lot of church artifacts and religious paintings. The guide was very pleasant and welcoming. 3 euro is a fine entry price for this small museum.

Nice small museum slightly tucked away from the huge crowds of tourists in Granada. We paid 3€ for a guided tour where we learnt all about the life and work of San Juan de Dios. I usually avoid guided tours but our guide was really sweet and friendly so I didn’t mind it.

Interesting museum about San Juan de Dios, who died in this very building. We had a private tour for two for only 3 euros per person. The museum has relics as well as gifts from all around the world. A lot of gold and ivory. The ticket you get here gets you a small discount on the already cheap Basilica de San Juan de Dios where he had his hospital.
Es una pequeña iglesia en el Albaycin. En ella se encuentra la obra de José de Mora, un crucificado de un realismo espectacular

Al lado del río Darro. Frente a la Alhambra, desde la misma puedes timar los caminos oara subir a la Alhambra o, por el contrario, adentrarse en el barrio del Albaicín. Elijas el camino que elijas es una buena opción. Como edificio religioso los hay más majestuosos en la ciudad, pero tienen una agrupación musical impresionante.
Es un museo. Alberga obras como San José de Ruiz del Peral, el Santísimo Cristo de la Misericordia del Silencio, de José de Mora o el Cristo del Perdón de Diego de Siloé. Es de visita obligada.
Santísimo Cristo de La Misericordia. Cristo del Silencio
Construida sobre la mezquita de los Morabitos. Ejemplar único de minarete convertido en campanario
Like a garden from paradise. MashAllah.
Wonderful mosque with an open patio to the most breathtaking view of Alhambra :)
Beautiful mosque having excellent view of Al Hambra from it's graden.
Just excellent experience.  Warm and Welcoming locals.
It deserves to be seen.

Please please do NOT waste your time or money here. It's just a pile of dirt. And holes. With no explanations whatsoever or no audio guide.

Take this from a guy who came to granada looking forward to seeing these ruins. What an incredible disconnect between what you read online (especially the reviews some people are giving) and what you get. 

You are just paying money to see empty holes and dirt. Seriously. See photos online.. More than good enough.

I spent all of 3m inside before realizing what a ripoff this place was. Unfortunately no refunds.

Very small Arab baths but well kept.  Kids go in for free and my husband and I paid 10 euros.  Honestly, they should not charge anything.  Next day we drove up to the town of Jael and visited another Arab bath, the largest one in Europe, for free!!!
Liked it. Very small, in 10 minutes it's al seen. Ticket is 5 eur and includes two other venues.
Very well preserved Arab baths!  Impressive the tablet shows you how it was originally,  but it works only one of the two.... Entrance 5€ for three sites
Interesting visit! Arabic baths were in good condition and although quite small our tickets provided us access to 2 other historic sites in Granada. It was certainly worth it.
Small but interesting look into the ancient caves where many people used to live. Getting up there certainly gives exercise. Nice view to the Alhambra.

An interesting journey on foot from the city centre of Granada to this place. A sort of an uphill climb and during a hot summer afternoon can be quite challenging. Once there one can enjoy the cave dwellings of gypsies which are a few and could be made more interesting with live shows etc. Not many people were there when I visited.
It's on like a big hill, so if you are planning on walking there, bring water. Or try to get a taxi to drop you off as close as it can to the museum. I would high recommend check this place out.

Interesting history, cordial staff. Learned a great deal about gypsies and their culture. Colorful and great views. Self guided tours. Not an easy walk for people with physical limitations. Even the walk from bus stop to museum has many steps.

Really interesting little museum set in the caves. I walked through the squatted caves area over the back of the church on the hill which was like nowhere I’ve ever seen! Wished I’d worn my blundstones as the paths are rough. Amazing views over Mountains and deep into the valley.
One of the old Gates of Granada city dating back to late 19s.
Beautiful
The gate
I like sooo much :-)

Preciosa. Una de las maravillas de la ciudad que gracias a Dios (o al ayuntamiento, depende de tus creencias) se mantiene en buen estado para admirar desde cerca o desde el principio de Gran Vía, desde donde se obtiene la bella imagen del Albayzín de la Alhacaba, con la Puerta Monaita y los últimos restos de la muralla de la ciudad.

Pay the little price for ticket entrance, it absolutely deserves it. Begin your visit in counterclockwise order, going on your right when you reach the first cloister. In this way, you will live your visit like in a climax: you will think to have waste your money and your time, just to take a look to apparently valueless pictures or forniture. Then you will become aware of little details, like the tombs of the former friars, who lie just under your feet, all around the cloister. They are still there, quiet and silent. Eventually, you will reach the church and you will be hit by an explosion of colours. The church is simply incredible, you will spend some minutes with an open mouth and the head pointed to the fine decored ceiling.

This was one of the best place to see in Granada, definitely.

I only saw the outside and it's impossing, beautiful. Bear in mind when visiting Spanish cities the siesta hours. By the time I arrived to Granada, they were closing for siesta break. And so were the other basilicas  nearby, except the Cathedral that does remain open.
I've seen a lot of churches, from Russia to Poland but this is the most amazing church I've ever seen. 4€ are totally worth it. I've never seen such an amazing place
Gorgeous cathedral in a uniquely Portuguese Manuelite style. Beautiful and fascinating history of Portugal in the lower courtyard burial room.

Beautiful monastery that is a bit off the beaten path.   Because of this it does not receive as many visitors.  This is a shame because it is absolutely worth a visit when you are in Granada.  Take your time and really admire the space.  

Small entrance fee of 4 euros when I went.
Went there for mass on Christmas 2018 and had my rosary blessed. Will never forget this moment and remember forever
A beautiful church , with stunning adornments, we were lucky to be in it for a wedding and the ceremony added to the churches' beauty.
Really nice place!!
Was very interesting
Feel blessed.
Wonderful visit to Lorca's summer and last house. "Called Huerta de San Vicente" by his father honouring his wife Doña Vicenta.

Took a nice tour (roughly 45 minutes) though Lorca's summer home. The tour guide I had spoke English, but very fast and with a strong accent. However, she was willing to answer any questions :)
The home is filled with rich history, beautiful decor, and many forms of amazing artwork. A nice experience to have!!! Definitely worth your time if you love literature, art, old Spanish homes, etc.
If you like Lorca you must visit the place
Great place for relaxing and culture.
Cuidada a medias. El Parque de García Lorca (Huerta de San Vicente) sería precioso si estuviera bien cuidado. Poco personal y control contra la ventanilla barata.
Very pretty river with good footpaths along its banks.
Is a great place for free air
Love the place is so peaceful

* Zona muy bonita que ofrece avistamiento de aves, contacto con la naturaleza, buenas vistas, diversidad de flora. 
* Merece la pena caminar por ahi.
* Ojo, no hay sombra, recomendable llevar agua y gorra, dependiendo del tiempo que se vaya a estar.
Buen contacto con la naturaleza y muy bonito
Excellent food very reasonably priced. Great staff and very welcoming atmosphere. We enjoyed a tajin and some brochettes as well as a couple of desserts.

Simply awesome. Place is awesome, food is awesome and so are the people. And the price is very very reasonable!  But there is another restaurant of the same name in front on one of the alleys. Don’t be confused. This one is tucked at the corner and you seem to be like entering from its back door. Check the interiors with the photos posted here to avoid getting to the wrong one.
Good meal & great service. Ordered a mixed appetizer and 2 Tagines, a chicken with olives and lemon and a lamb with prunes and almonds. Both great.
Delicious Moroccan food in a restaurant that quickly fills up in the evening (and with good reason). Try the pasteles, although you might find yourself waddling out the door.
One of the best Moroccan restaurants in Granada. The traditional kuskus and tagen was very tasty. The decorations adding special feeling for the Arabian atmosphere.
I still dream of their happy hour over a decade later. It may have changed by now but I remember spending many an evening here grabbing a glass of wine and amazing and unique tapas.
Perhaps the best tapas I've had in Spain. Lovely spot that combines the atmosphere of a dive bar with truly excellent food.

I loved Poë so much that I came back the next night. Drinks and tapas are very affordable. I tried most of the tapas and my favorites were the spicy dishes, which had enough kick to be a refreshing change from the less spicy typical Spanish food. I also thought that the vegetarian dishes were also pretty tasty! When I came there the crowd was a little bit more tourists than locals, maybe because I came earlier in the evening. However, it seemed to be tourists who were looking for a more non traditional place, so I wouldn't take the fact that I didn't see a ton of locals as a bad sign. I noticed that the owner was very friendly with all the patrons. If I had a bar like Poë near where I lived, I would be there every week!
Great bar. Really nice place with some really good tapas! Highly recommended!!!
If you're in Granada give this place a try, you won't be disappointed. Great atmosphere with matching tapas and drinks.

When in Granada you must come here! This was the first place we went to once we arrived in Granada and we couldn’t have picked a better place. The food was DELICIOUS. everyone around us ordered the same tapas platter, so you know it’s good! Seating outside and friendly service

Absolutely perfect! Our bus was due to leave very soon so unfortunately we couldn't stay longer. The food was delicious, the beer was cold, and the staff were able to accommodate our short window. We will definitely be back the next time we're in Granada!

Literally perfect. Amazing drinks (the sangria was sublime) and tapas, at a very fair price. Gets quite busy in the evening and is incredibly well managed by the few people who serve. Great atmosphere, both during the day and in the evening. Only had three days in Granada and we went every day. No wonder many locals go there. Definitely recommend!

This place is A1. We came here in the morning and loved it so much that we came back that same evening for dinner. All of the tapas are delicious and reasonably priced. It’s especially nice for tourists because although they clearly know you’re foreign (we are American) they treat you as if they’re going to see you again: with attentiveness which is really hard to find.

The place is awesome, tapas/food are delicious, and service is really fast! The only problem—they’re so good that the place is always packed! We were lucky to find a table/bar spot for 2 nights in a row during our 3 nights in Granada, and next time I am in town I will for sure grab a drink and tapas at the Bodega!!

Way too many people for my liking because it's famous. The pool is always full of families and friend groups. But it's got a good beach front. The waters are calmer than in Patar Beach. Ideal for kids.

Private and quiet... very relaxing and wholesome! Not many rules ehich is good but everyone is respectful of each ones space ... good place for events or team buildings and most especially some good ole quality family time

Good place. The attic room was perfect to relax. Slides at the swimming pool were fun but the beach.... it was disappointing. 
Oh!  the coffee there tastes really good. Try it.

Made my first time in Bolinao so amazing. The place is very strategic most especially if you rent for tour. The room is very affordable and there are amenities and activities that are fun. I really love the tables near the beach especially when it is flooded by water. this place is clean and classy :)

Its a fair place to stay for an overnight and all. I think I just have a high standard because of their pictures and all in their website that wasn't really true when we were there. Its a little bit noisy since its open to all. The  beach picture from their website was amazing but when we went there its not.
Fantastic Kebab at affordable price! Loved it and shared it with my friends :)
Chicken tasted bad, oily. Rice was bland, pita kebab was okay. Hummus is the worst I have ever tasted in my entire life. Have to ask them how they make it so bad. Place looked ugly and unsanitary
Really bad food and service! The guy was rude and when i asked for some sauce, he said he does not have any! After having the food my stomach felt weird! This place should be shut down!
Good taste and good price

very nice restaurant. You can either eat here or take away. The service is very good. The staff is very friendly.The price is very cheap but the food is very tasty.There are also a lot of combi menu which you can buy several dishes but with a lower price.

We experienced a unique dinner at Francisco’s place. He was very welcoming and it felt like we are at a friend’s home. We tried very good typical spanish food and Francisco explained us where ingredients came from. Francisco truly cares about his guests. We also enjoyed getting to know the other guests. Food and wine were of the highest quality and there is no other place where you get a similar experience. Thank you Francisco, see you next time.
A well hidden secret!!! A wonderful and personal treat!!😘😍 The host makes you feel so.... special!!!  Each plate was a wonderful surprise!

Just so much fun! Last year,  my wife and I and three other friends had dinner at La Oliva in Granada. While this isnt a "real restaurant", it was one of the most interesting dining experiences we've ever had. Francisco is a wonderfully friendly sweet man who delights in surprising and educating his guests about olives, olive oil, wines, and delicious, simply prepared foods. Dinner was 3 1/2 hours of interesting and varied taste delights coupled with 5 different Spanish wines. We left full, satisfied, energized (and a bit tipsy!) 

Our meal was course after course of tastings ... a couple of bites of this followed by a couple of bites of that. Always something new and interesting. Each one was prepared by hand by Francisco on nothing more than a 2 burner hotplate, but each course was just delicious. The biggest surprise was a "traditional winter salad": sliced oranges topped with green onion, radishes, salted cod, pepper, and of course, olive oil. Not a combination I would have ever thought about, but it was wonderful! 

Dont go there is you expect a regular restaurant experience: waiters, maitre d's, and wine lists. . You'll be disappointed. But if you want an interesting delicious food experience, make it a point to visit Francisco at La Oliva.

Just try it! 
Its like having a 15-17 dish tasting menu in your living room with your friends. Maximum 13 guests so book in advance! We got lucky and charmed us a seat for two even though it was full, thanks Francisco and his staff for the evening!

O lugar promete oferecer uma experiência gastronômica, mas está longe disso. Sim, é um menu degustação, são várias porções servidas, mas absolutamente nada de extraordinário. A cozinha espanhola é fabulosa e comemos coisas muito mais saborosas em simples bares de tapas, por exemplo. Francisco conta sobre a história e origem dos ingredientes, encanta com o discurso, parecia mesmo que teríamos uma boa refeição. Mas a comida deixa muito a desejar. Os vinhos oferecidos também são sofríveis. A ideia de reunir todos os clientes na mesma mesa é simpática e divertida, o próprio Francisco é gentil, mas, infelizmente, a experiência em
termos de gastronomia foi decepcionante.

Very poor service. Arrived after seeing an offer of 10 tapas for €10 which we thought was a good deal. Ordered straight away, had to wait almost a full hour before our food came. Kept telling us every 5 mins it would be coming but only after nearly a full hour did it come and to be honest the food was not worth the wait. Some food meant to be hot was luke warm. Not impressed
I usually don’t do this but I have to let people know that this place is awful. Awful service (we waited almost 1 hour for a terrible cold food). It’s definitely a tourist trap. Avoid it.
I liked a lot, good tapas, I would definitely go back

Avoid this place. We ordered caña+tapa for 1.80 (average beer, "tapa"- old bread with small piece of jamon). When we asked to pay the price rised to 2.40 instead of 1.80. We asked for explanation and the waiter in very rude way told us that instead of caña they put the beer in a glass and it costs more. Of course nobody told us the price in advance.

Be careful with this place. Deceitful pricing. Rude service. Also cunningly used the language barrier against us despite the fact that he does speak English.
Many better places around to choose from.
